markdownContent:
**“Since global histories often proceed from a survey rather than from an archival excavation, they are unlikely to uncover the social networks, imaginative worlds, and small acts of resistance of ordinary people, and more likely to foreground actors who are already prominent in histories written at the level of the nation-state.”**
Stanley, “Maidservants' Tales: Narrating Domestic and Global History in Eurasia, 1600-1900” (2016: 439).
